required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Expanded Access Study of Bemarituzumab (FPA144) for a Single Patient With Recurrent Bladder Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: An Expanded Access Study of Bemarituzumab (FPA144) for a Single Patient With Recurrent Bladder Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open-label, expanded access protocol to continue administration of bemarituzumab (FPA144) in a single patient with recurrent bladder cancer

detailed_description.textblock: This protocol is intended to provide access to bemarituzumab (FPA144 an investigational agent) to a single patient with recurrent bladder cancer who had a response to study drug on FPA144-001. That study is closing and this expanded access protocol allows this single patient to continue receiving this agent.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Understand and sign an Institutional Review Board-approved informed consent form prior to receiving bemarituzumab
2. Previously enrolled on the FPA144-001 study, received bemarituzumab and obtained clinical benefit from the investigational product (IP) administration
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Pregnancy and lactation
